name: ColorScheme
desc: The possible color schemes, corresponding to the light and dark appearances.

items.name: case light
items.desc: The color scheme that corresponds to a light appearance.

items.name: case dark
items.desc: The color scheme that corresponds to a dark appearance.

items.name: init?(UIUserInterfaceStyle)
items.desc: Creates a color scheme from its user interface style equivalent.

items.name: static var allCases: [ColorScheme]
items.desc: A collection of all values of this type.

items.name: typealias AllCases
items.desc: A type that can represent a collection of all values of this type.

items.name: static func == (ColorScheme, ColorScheme) -> Bool
items.desc: Indicates whether two color schemes are equal.

items.name: static func != (Self, Self) -> Bool
items.desc: Indicates whether two color schemes are unequal.

items.name: func hash(into: inout Hasher)
items.desc: Hashes the essential components of the color scheme by passing them into the given hash function.

items.name: var hashValue: Int
items.desc: The hashed value of the color scheme.

items.name: struct PreferredColorSchemeKey
items.desc: A key for specifying the preferred color scheme.
